page.title: 06AN AFTERNOON AT CAUSEY.
page.content: On Friday 21st June 1985 we visited the area called the Causey to see for ourselves the famous{Causey Arch. {THE CAUSEY }is a conservation area where nature is allowed to flourish. The old Tanfield Waggonway is now just a track. A Nature Warden is employed by Durham County Council to patrol the area. There are many species of birds nesting in the trees; magpies, chaffinches,hawfinches,wrens and even, a rare bird,the crossbill. There is a jagged sandstone rockface which is often used by climbers as a practice ground. A large notice is displayed which points out that the rocks should not be climbed without proper equipment or experience. Anyone climbing these rocks do so at their own risk. We enjoyed this peaceful spot and the dramatic grandeur of the Causey Arch.
